title.rendered: Team Queso and FnaticTQ accounts hacked to promote NFTs

content.rendered:
In the age of cryptocurrencies and NFTs, not everyone is dedicated to the “clean” business, groups that are dedicated to scamming through NFTs have been hacking accounts on different social networks in order to take advantage of the large numbers of followers and followers. This way promote the sale of your content. This is the case of what happened to Team Cheese Y fnaticTQ on their Twitter accounts.

Both teams have suffered from a hack with appropriation of the accounts, so so far neither of the two organizations have yet been able to recover the users. This was announced by «Alvaro845», CEO and founder of Team Cheese on his personal Twitter account, and then asked followers to report that the accounts are hijacked.

Our @TeamQuesoGG and @FnaticTQ accounts have been hacked to promote fucking monkey NFTs 🙈😂

– Alvaro845 (@Alvaro845) April 5, 2022

A similar background

Just eight days ago, the Mexican Leonardo López Pérez, better known as MkLeo, has had his personal account hacked by a group that promoted alleged NFTs related to ThePossessedNFT account. At first impression, some came to believe that the Mexican would have entered the world of blockchain, however after clarifying the situation and making the respective complaints, MkLeo He got his account back within a few hours.

Hello there, this is mkleo speaking, just wanna say FUCK NFT and fuck whoever did this, finally got my account back, if you dont believe ask me something only the real Leo would know. Thank you for spreading the word, love you all ❤️

— T1 | MkLeo (@Mkleosb) March 29, 2022

Hello this is MkLeo, I just wanted to say FUCK THE NFTs and who did this. I was finally able to recover my account »the Mexican wrote the exact moment that I was able to have his Twitter account again and thanked his followers« Thank you for spreading the word, I love you «.

If the times of Twitter are the same, in the next few hours we will have news about a possible recovery of the accounts of both Team Cheese like the fnaticTQ. For the time being, the corresponding Twitter report will have to be made.

More in our Community section.
